settings.title: Newsletter
settings.content: For all the latest updates and exclusive offers, follow us on social media and subscribe to our newsletter.

settings.partner_title: Working in partnership with over 20 schools & organisations:

settings.directions_value: Great Western studios, 65 Alfred road, london w2 5EU

settings.notes_placeholder: Please add any special instructions for your booking here

settings.title: Creative
settings.content: We encourage children to learn to code through making while flexing their creative muscles, learning resilience and problem solving.

settings.title: Collaborative
settings.content: In our clubs and camps, coding becomes a social activity. We encourage children to collaborate and work together.

settings.title: World skills
settings.content: We believe every child should learn to code and gain digital literacy skills. These skills will equip them to be well-educated citizens in a rapidly changing world.

settings.title: Fun
settings.content: Our clubs are a balance of hard work, thinking, play, and online and offline activities. Children come away loving coding and robotics and delighted by the things they make.

settings.title: Our Mission
settings.text: Our aim is to enable and encourage children aged 5 to 14 to be digital creators and support their parents and teachers. We want to inspire all children, whether they're naturally inclined to learn to code or not, about the things they can make and do with code.

settings.title: Our vision
settings.text: We believe that if taught with a focus on creativity, learning to code will not only equip children with the technical skills they need to excel in the future, but will also teach them critical problem solving skills.

settings.title: Our services
settings.text: We run after-school clubs at a growing roster of schools, workshops and camps. Our courses have looked at everything from designing wearables to 3D printing to creating VR experiences with code.

settings.title: Heather Lyons
settings.subtitle: Founder & Director
settings.content: Heather was bitten by the tech bug early and began building websites as a young adult. Heather has an MA in Architecture from Princeton University & has done advanced study in Computer Science at UCL. She taught computer-based design at the Architectural Association & has worked in digital media since 1999, before founding blue{shift} in 2013. Heather is also a local mum with three young children.

settings.title: Laura Satkauskaite
settings.subtitle: Operations & Communications
settings.content: Laura is the go-to operations person at all of our camps, looking after all matters related to the smooth running of each. She manages the planning, staffing, & delivery of our main products - keeping students, parents, and teachers alike in the loop at all times! Laura holds a degree in Media and Communications from Bournemouth University. She is also an avid Love Island fan!

settings.title: Jordan Wu
settings.subtitle: Curriculum & Content
settings.content: With a background in creative technology, Jordan has a BsC in Digital Arts and Computing from Goldsmiths University. Originally joining blue{shift} as a teacher, he now creates our curriculum & other educational content (as well as occasionally teaching). Other than art, Jordan has a keen interest in virtual reality, developing new kinds of immersive experiences through programmes and games.

settings.title: Uvie Pereira
settings.subtitle: Operations & Policy
settings.content: Uvie's role at blue{shift} focuses on facilitating logistics and policy for camps and events, particularly looking at future-facing strategy. Having studied at Cambridge—where she received a BA in Social and Political Sciences—Uvie will be studying a part-time masters in Human-Computer Interaction at City University. Outside of her passion for working in Ed-Tech, she enjoys creative writing and learning about zen philosophy.

settings.title: Adam Crowther
settings.subtitle: Marketing & Partnerships
settings.content: Adam is responsible for spreading the word about blue{shift} to both school partners and parents. With a social science background, he enjoys capturing the creativity and imagination of our students as well as communicating with all kinds of people. Adam has a BA in Social Anthropology from the London School of Economics. He also can't help but wear bright colours around the office.

settings.title: Katie Alphey
settings.subtitle: Operations & Events
settings.content: With a background in education, Katie has experience with primary school age children with SEN and behavioural difficulties. She now ensures that blue{shift}'s after-school clubs, private tuition, and camps run effortlessly. Katie has a BSc in Psychology from the University of Birmingham. With a love for music Katie has previously organised a charity festival which helped to raise over £70,000!

settings.title: Our Teachers
settings.text: Our superstar teachers come from a diverse range of academic and creative backgrounds - from digital artists to software engineers. Find out more about them here!

settings.title: The blue{shift} Story
settings.text: We have been offering clubs, camps, and workshops in West London for over five years - learn about how we got started and why we do what we do here.

settings.title: Nick
settings.content: With previous experience in EdTech and other tech start-ups, Nick has been living and working in London for eight years. For him, learning to code gives a person the ability to create powerful tools that positively impact the lives of others. He also particularly enjoys teaching our youngest learners. It is for these reasons that Nick is currently in the process of developing a language-learning game aimed at younger students.

settings.title: Daniel
settings.content: For Daniel coding combines problem solving with creative ways of thinking. This approach to tech has allowed him to marry programming with another of his passions - music. He often uses code to build his own software and interfaces for creating and performing music, and he has led workshops on music computing, acoustics, and sound design. This control over the creative process, he says, is what makes it so liberating to be a coder.

settings.title: Johanna
settings.content: Johanna is originally from Sweden and is a digital artist when she isn’t teaching. She uses technology as a key part of her art. For her physical computing, specifically microprocessors, allows her art practice to become more interactive and participatory. This ability to incorporate coding into everyday life, in novel and creative ways, is a key reason why Johanna enjoys programming so much.

settings.title: Easter Holiday Tuition
settings.text: Equip your child with lifelong skills in the comfort of your own home. Taught by an experienced tutor at a time and place that suits you, our easy and flexible holiday tuition is an ideal option for all kids this Easter.

settings.title: The four skills coding develops
settings.text: We believe that learning to code is about more than just developing tech skills. Instead, it can be helpful in developing key characteristics that are also vital in other school subjects.  Click below to read more on our blog.

settings.title: Workshops
settings.text: We offer bespoke coding and robotics workshops which can take place over a single day or an entire week. Find out what a blue{shift} workshop looks like here.

settings.title: After School Clubs
settings.text: We offer four levels of clubs and classes for children in Reception to Year 8. More details on our after school club curriculum can be found here.

settings.title: Experienced
settings.text: All blue{shift} teachers are experienced and passionate computer scientists in their own right. With a variety of interests our educators have experience coding and designing across many industries - from ship engineering and instrument design, to digital art, language acquisition and the development of AI.

settings.title: Passionate
settings.text: All of our teaching staff are passionate about learning. With experience of teaching at our

settings.title: Innovative
settings.text: With new and innovative computing and robotics products, our teachers are able to engage students in exciting projects such as 3D printing, virtual reality, and e-textiles.

settings.title: Our Mission
settings.text: Our aim is to enable and encourage children aged 5 to 16 to be digital creators, and to support their parents and teachers every step of the way. We want to teach all children, whether they're naturally inclined to learn to code or not, about the things they can make and do with code.

settings.title: Our Services
settings.text: We run after-school clubs, private tuition, workshops, and holiday camps. Our courses have looked at everything from designing wearables and 3D printing to creating VR experiences, games, and movies with code.

settings.title: Our Vision
settings.text: We believe that if taught with a focus on creativity, learning to code will not only equip children with the technical skills they need to excel in the future, but will also teach them critical problem solving skills.

settings.banner_title: COMING SOON: Online coding classes for children aged 7 to 14

settings.title: WATCH: 2020 HOLIDAY CAMPS
settings.text: With courses in coding, robotics, animation, game design, electronics & more we have something for every child's creativity! Watch the video to get an idea of what to expect from our 2020 holiday coding camps.
"My son says blue{shift}’s Minecraft camp was the best thing he has ever done, ever!”
"By all accounts, the day went really well. The children's feedback has been great - some even want to come and work here now!"
"The blue{shift} teachers are incredibly knowledgeable and we were impressed with how they delivered inspiring content"
settings.sub_text: Ms. Watt, Deputy Head, Eaton Square Kensington

settings.title: VIDEO | Holiday Camps
settings.text: We think that our camps are super fun. But you shouldn't just take our word for it. We recently spoke to some of the blue{shift} teachers and students to find out more; watch our video to get a better idea of what makes a blue{shift} camp such a great adventure!
“The things I liked most about camp were proper teaching, creative approach and the fact that my daughter really learnt something while having fun”

settings.title: Three types of tuition
settings.bottom_content:
All of our teaching staff undergo a rigorous application and on-boarding process. Each teacher is then vetted by the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS).

We provide training and support for all our teachers, and many of our teaching staff have taught at some of London's most prestigious schools. To read more, click here.

settings.form_text: If you would like to download a series of example camp schedules, please enter your details below:

settings.title: Can I use my childcare vouchers to pay for this course?
settings.answer: Yes! If you would like to use your childcare vouchers to book this course, head on over to our childcare voucher page. This page will walk you through our childcare voucher process and allow you to reserve your child’s space on their chosen course whilst you process your payment.

settings.title: Which Creative Coding level should I sign my child up for?
settings.answer: Each of our courses have a recommended age group. However, if your child has done coding before, they might be ready to go to a more advanced class. We suggest following the stated age range for each course, and to contact us for advice if you feel your child has more experience than that age range suggests. Click the chat icon in the bottom right of your screen if you'd like to get in touch.

settings.title: My child doesn't have a laptop - will an iPad or tablet suffice instead?
settings.answer: Unfortunately the programs and tools we use in our classes do not run adequately on tablet devices at the moment. We use iPads in the Mini Coders and Animation courses, but we will provide these devices.

settings.title: Is there any specific software I should install in advance?
settings.answer:
Our Junior students will need Scratch on their laptops and we also recommend having a bookmark to the Scratch website ready, as sometimes we do work online. 

For Minecraft Modders students, you should install Minecraft and the LearnToModprogram (note you will also need a Minecraft license - these can be bought via us when booking). We recommend that you also install the Google Chrome web browser.

settings.schools_title: We teach over 500 children at more than 45 clubs every week!
settings.schools_text:
As trusted provider of coding education in over 20 schools, we offer after school clubs, holiday camps, workshops, private tuition and in-school classes at some of London's most prestigious schools. Below is a list of the schools we currently work alongside but we are always looking for new schools to add to our portfolio.

If  you are a computing teacher or club coordinator and would like to know more please get in touch, we’d love to hear from you.

settings.text: "The blue{shift} teachers are incredibly knowledgeable and the Eaton Square teaching team were impressed with how they delivered inspiring course content to the children. Pupils were engaged, enjoying their lessons and making huge strides in their technical ability throughout the course of their club."

"It was well planned and resourced fantastically. Every girl was fully engaged and the knowledgeable staff were fantastic at guiding the girls to make good progress in their knowledge of coding. Great communication before also meant the timetabling of events worked seamlessly. I hope to continue working with blue{shift} in the future!"

settings.title: Teaching
settings.text:
Partnerships with leading universities ensure top students & graduates join our faculty.

All teachers are fully trained, with experience teaching at a variety of schools

settings.title: Curriculum
settings.text:
Curriculum devised in conjunction with UCL Department of Education.  

Industry leaders within the coding education field, providing the latest technologies and teaching pedagogy

settings.title: Our Service
settings.text:
Bespoke and tailored to each partnership, our club service is flexible to each schools needs.

Our graduates go on to study computer science at leading secondary schools and universities.
